Article Title: Less than a week after Georgia shooting, Houston school placed on lockdown
Article Text: Less than a week after a deadly shooting at Georgia's Apalachee High School which resulted in the deaths of two teachers and two student, Hilltop Elementary School in Bonaire, Houston County, was placed on lockdown after a report of a potential gunman on school grounds.The incident at Hilltop Elementary occurred on Wednesday afternoon during dismissal. Jennifer Jones , a spokesperson for the Houston County School District , said that authorities were alerted to a possible gunman. Law enforcement quickly arrived at the scene and conducted a sweep of the school. Fortunately, no evidence of an armed individual was found. "Law enforcement immediately arrived, and after a complete sweep, the school was cleared, and normal operations resumed," Jones told WMaz Tv.Following the search, the school returned to a 'code green,' meaning safety protocols were lifted, and students were dismissed under police supervision. A message was sent to parents informing them of the situation. Jones reassured the community, stating that an investigation is ongoing and updates would be provided as more information becomes available.The lockdown has sparked concern among parents and school officials, especially given the rise in school-related threats across Georgia since the Apalachee High School tragedy. According to Jones, many districts have been dealing with an increase in threats, leading to heightened security measures and, in some cases, school closures .One parent, after receiving news of the lockdown, expressed relief when it was lifted, but acknowledged the ongoing fear. "After what happened in Georgia last week, you never know how safe your children really are," she told AP. The recent events highlight the growing unease in schools, with districts nationwide facing increased challenges in ensuring student safety.
Article Summary: Hilltop Elementary School in Bonaire, Georgia, was placed on lockdown after a report of a potential gunman on school grounds. Law enforcement quickly arrived at the scene and conducted a sweep of the school. The lockdown has sparked concern among parents and school officials, especially given the rise in school- related threats.

Article Title: Pak charges Imran party lawmakers with terror offences
Article Text: ISLAMABAD : Several lawmakers and leaders of jailed former Pakistani PM Imran Khan 's party arrested after a rally they held to demand his release have been charged with terrorism offences, according to police on Wednesday. The lawmakers have been in police custody since being arrested after Sunday's rally turned violent, and will remain in custody until Sept 18 for investigation, said police officer Zafar Khan and a party official.CM Ali Amin Gandapur of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province is among those facing the charges. Article Title: Gunmen kill a polio worker during a vaccination campaign in Pakistan
Article Text: KHAR: Gunmen on motorcycles opened fire Wednesday on police escorting a team of polio workers during a door-to-door vaccination campaign in northwestern Pakistan , killing an officer and a polio worker, police said.No one immediately claimed responsibility for the attack in Bajur, a district in the Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province and a former stronghold of the Pakistani Taliban , according to local police chief Abdul Aziz.Pakistan's Interior Minister Mohsin Naqvi issued a statement condemning the attack.Pakistan on Monday launched a nationwide polio campaign amid a spike in militant attacks. The potentially fatal, paralysing disease mostly strikes children under age 5 and typically spreads through contaminated water.That same day, a roadside bomb hit a vehicle carrying officers assigned to protect health workers conducting polio immunisation in the northwestern South Waziristan district, in the same province, wounding six officers and three civilians.The militant Islamic State group later claimed responsibility for Monday's attack.Anti-polio campaigns in Pakistan are regularly marred by violence. Militants target vaccination teams and police assigned to protect them, falsely claiming that the campaigns are a Western conspiracy to sterilise children.Since January, Pakistan has reported 17 new cases of polio, jeopardising decades of efforts to eliminate polio in the country. Pakistan and Afghanistan are the only countries in which the spread of polio has never been stopped.
Article Summary: No one immediately claimed responsibility for the attack in Bajur, a district in the Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province. Pakistan's Interior Minister Mohsin Naqvi issued a statement condemning the attack. Pakistan on Monday launched a nationwide polio campaign amid a spike in militant attacks.
